markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Katar](/Weapons.aspx?ID=369)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Agile" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=170" />
<trait label="Deadly d6" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=174" />
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=112" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Tian Xia Character Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=230) pg. 127, [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 277 <sup>2.0</sup>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Characters from Tian Xia, Vudra, or Impossible Lands have access to this option_

**Favored Weapon** [Atreia](/Deities.aspx?ID=686), [Mestama](/Deities.aspx?ID=519), [Nyarlathotep (The Faceless Sphinx)](/Deities.aspx?ID=574), [Yig](/Deities.aspx?ID=579)

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 3 sp

**Damage** 1d4 P

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 1

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Type** Melee

**Category** Simple

**Group** [Knife](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=9)
</row>

</column>

---

Also known as punching daggers, katars are characterized by their H-shaped hand grip that allows the blade to jut out from the knuckles.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-9" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Weapons</title>
[Shuln Fang Katar](/Equipment.aspx?ID=3208)
name: Katar
